result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen J. Szuflita was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with the sentence in 16CF27. Costs have been waived by the Court. No jail time imposed; Court leaves that as a tool for Corrections to use as they see fit.
Concurrent with: 16CF27

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing  June 12, 2017
PSI amended at Sentencing 6/12/17

16CF20/Count 2/maintaining drug trafficking house, 16CF23/Count 1/manufacture and delivery of schedule IV drugs, 16CF27/Count 1/manufacture and delivery of schedule I, II narcotics, and 16CF22/Count 1/manufacture and delivery of THC. Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def has previously pleaded guilty to these offenses. Court has reviewed the PSI and considered the PSI notations and arguments on sentencing made by the DA for the State, Atty. Frank for the Defense, and the Def on his own behalf.

16CF27 - 8 years prison with 3 years initial confinement and 5 years ES. Dodge Correctional as reception center. 310 days credit by stipulation. 

16CF20, 16CF22 and 16CF23 - 6 years probation imposed, concurrent with the sentence in 16CF27. No jail time imposed/stayed as the Court leaves that as a tool for Corrections to use as they see fit. 

Conditions of extended supervision and probation: no alcohol or altering substance w/o prescription; no entry into any place with sale of alcohol; treatment programming, counseling or education as deemed necessary; pay restitution, court costs, and supervision fees. 

One set of court costs - ordered in 16CF27. Court costs waived in 16CF20, 16CF22 and 16CF23.

Substance Abuse Programming - yes. Challenge Incarceration - no.

Atty. Frank addresses Court re seized property. Court states motion to be brought. DA says she and counsel will further discuss; asks for correspondence/request from counsel for DA's review.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Cases 16CF23, 16CF27,16CF20, 16CF22 called together.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Frank requests a sentencing hearing be set.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Frank requests rescheduling 30 days out.  No objection from the State.  Atty. Frank asks for 30 days to consider whether next scheduling will be requested as plea/sentencing or something else.  Court sets next date for TSC/telephone status 4/26 at 1:30.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on March 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Status in 16CF22, 16CF23, 16CF27, and 16CF20.  Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper recaps what has occurred with the taking of the def's plea and then the def's statement that he wanted to withdraw his plea and fire his attorney; def now has SPD counsel, Atty. Mark Frank and this is Atty. Frank's first appearance.  Atty. Frank has met with the Def and asks for further status of these matters.  Court sets TSC for 3/17 at 1:30 - Atty. Frank to phone in.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Disclosure and Motion for Discovery
Status conference on February 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.

16CF20, 16CF22, 16CF23, and 16CF27 called together for status.  Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA notes that Atty. Peter Bartelt had been on these matters but withdrew.  Def is presently without counsel.  Def states he talked with the SPD office earlier this week but hasn't heard back.  Clerk calls SPD office.  SPD states they've contacted Atty. D Franker and are waiting to hear.  Def states he had someone call Atty. Franker and Franker can't take.  Court suggests Atty. D Saperstein.  SPD office is going to contact D Saperstein.  Further status set for 2/10 at 11 with the hope that Def has SPD counsel by that point.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Granting Counsel Leave to Withdraw (Atty. Bartelt withdrawing)
for Leave to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant Stephen Szuflita
Plea Hearing  October 5th, 2016
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

1:59 p.m.  4 cases on the calendar for sentencing today:  16CF20, 16CF22, 16CF23, and 16CF27.   Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. PSI author also present.  DA Harper informs the Court that today was to be the date for sentencing in this matter, however, she has just been informed by Atty. Bartelt that the Def wishes to withdraw his pleas.  DA requests that the Defense file a formal, written motion.  Court will allow the Defense to file a motion, stating fair and just reason for their request.  Court directs Atty. Bartelt to file his motion by December 30th.  State's response due January 20th.  Status set for February 1st at 10.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for status:  16CF20, 16CF21, 16CF22, 16CF23, 16CF27, and 16CF105.  Atty. Bartelt informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 2/maintaining drug trafficking place in 16CF20, count 1/manufacture and delivery of THC in 16CF22, count 1/manufacture and deliver of schedule IV drugs in 16CF23, and manufacture and deliver of schedule I/II narcotics in 16CF27; all other counts/cases to be dismissed and read in.

Def pleads guilty to the charges stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered; author to be available at least by phone; PSI due 11/16.  Sentencing set for 11/23 at 2.

All other counts and cases not pleaded to today dismissed and read-in.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment in 16CF20, 16CF21, 16CF22, 16CF23, and 16CF27; AIA in 16CF105.  Informations have been filed in 20, 21, 22, 23, and 27.  Atty. B - defense waives formal reading and enters NG pleas to all charges.  Court states the charges.  10/5 at 1:30 set for status in all matters except 16CF105 which is set for prelim that date/time.

Atty. B requests review of bail, presently set at 5k cash; asks for signature bond.  DA opposes the request.  Court denies the request.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant not to possess or consume any controlled substances for which he does not hold a valid prescription.  Submit to evidentiary testing of blood or urine at the demand of law enforcement to monitor compliance.

Defendant Stephen J. Szuflita in court, in custody. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  5 cases called together for first appearance/initial/bail hearing - 16CF20, 16CF21, 16CF22, 16CF23, and 16CF27.  Atty. Lisa McDougal appears by phone for the Defendant - special appearance for this hearing only as Atty. M might not be able to represent.  DA asks for 1k cash bond in each of the 5 cases with conditions to include no possession/consumption of controlled substances with test on demand to monitor compliance.  Def and Atty. M address the Court.  

Court sets $500 cash bond in each case for total of $2500 between the 5 cases.  Conditions:  Defendant not to possess or consume any controlled substances for which he does not hold a valid prescription.  Submit to evidentiary testing of blood or urine at the demand of law enforcement to monitor compliance.  

Court adjourns the initial appearance to allow SPD to appoint counsel - 2/3 at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
